pageContext.description: The female sitter and her son have been variously identified: as Duchess Catherine of Saxony with her son Moritz, as Duchess Sophie of Saxony with her son Johann Friedrich I and as Electress Sibylle with her son Johann Friedrich II, the Middle. Rohrich created numerous versions of this double portrait after the original version by Cranach now in the Royal Collection, London.
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 55 x 40.5 cm
[Muzeum Narodowe w Poznaniu, revised 2018]

metadata.title: Double Portrait of a Lady and her Son

pageContext.owner: Fundacja im. Raczynskich przy Muzeum Narodowym w Poznaniu
pageContext.provenance:
- from the collection of Count Athanase Raczynski, purchased in Nuremberg in 1820
- from 1853 in the Athanase Raczynski Gallery in Berlin
- 1884-1903 deposited and exhibited in the National Galerie in Berlin
- in 1903 transferred from Berlin as the property of Raczynski Family to the Kaiser Friedrich-Museum in Posen (Poznan). 
- from 1919 in the collection of the Muzeum Wielkopolskie then the Muzeum Narodowe in Poznan.
- since 1996 held as property of the Raczynski Foundation in the National Museum in Poznan. 
[Muzeum Narodowe w Poznaniu, revised 2018]

titles.title: Double Portrait of a Lady and her Son
